697.content: Overview about the relationships between concepts used in the SAF Operational Domain and the SAF Functional Domain . | Concept | Documentation | . | SCYenablingOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability integrates System Capabilities to produce a specific outcome to achieve a mission objective. | . | SDKtypingLIE | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Item Exchange. | . | SOIactingForOPR | Specifies the fact that a SOI is acting for the benefit of an Operational Performer. | . | Operational Domain Kind | Specifies the kind of Operational Item Exchange between Operational Context Roles or Operational Processes. | . | LCNallowingLIE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Item Exchange is allowed on the Logical Connection. | . | Logical System Context | Specifies the fact that a System Context for a System of Interest is defined on Logical Level. | . | Operational Context Role | An Operational Context Role represents a participant in an Operational context. It is interacting with other roles of the given Operational Context. Specific characteristics and features or, in case of persons or organizational units, knowledge and skills are assigned to a role necessary for the execution of the performed Operational Processes. | . | ODKtypifyingOIE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Domain Kind typifies an Operational Item Exchange. | . | Operational Item Exchange | Specifies the Operational Item Exchange that is to take place on an Operational Connection. Aliases: UAF::OperationalExchange | . | SRderivingFromSTKR | Specifies the fact that a System Requirement is derived from a Stakeholder Requirement. Note: It may be used in a customer supplier relationship situation and supports the V Model concept of "External Unit Specification". See [VXT]. | . | System Capability | 1) A System Capability is an operation or task that performs an action to produce a specific performance-based outcome. NOTE that a system capability represents the potential to perform an action. In contrast, an operational capability may integrate several physical system capabilities to produce a specific outcome to achieve a mission objective. [Wasson2006, SystemAnalysis+Design+Development] 2) System Capabilities, as system assets, characterize the mechanical, electrical, optical, or processing features that enable a system to function, process mission resources, make decisions, and achieve a required level of success based on performance. A system capability is broader in scope than simply a functional element (and performance bounding elements), especially in large, complex ecosystems. It represents a physical potential - strength, ability, endurance - to perform an outcome-based action for a given duration under a specified set of operating environment conditions. [Wasson2006, SystemAnalysis+Design+Development] Aliases: UAF::Capability NAF4::Capability | . | Operational Context | An Operational Context is representing a separate Usage Scenario with a specific configuration of Operational Performers, these are interacting in the Scenario exhibiting a specific identified Operational Capability. One or more Operational Contexts meaningful for the Operational Domain are to be identified. Aliases: UAF::HighLevelOperationalConcept | . | SHRrefiningOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | Logical Context Element Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | OPRexhibitingOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer exhibits an Operational Capability under specific environmental conditions. | . | SRrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by System Requirements. | . | SHRimposedBY | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is provided by Stakeholders. | . | Logical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. | . | Logical Context Element | Represents an abstract element in the given System Context on Logical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | LIEimplementsOIE | specifies that this exchange in the FD implements (possibly partly) that exchange in the OD | . | SSHrepresentingOPR | Specifies the fact that a SOI Stakeholder is representing an Operational Performer. | . | System Context Element | An abstract element representing a System Context Element. Base class for specific kinds of Context Elements. | . | SUCenablingOSY | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case enables the realization of an Operational Story. | . | System Of Interest | An abstract element representing a SOI. Base class for specific kinds of SOIs. | . | SRrefiningSCY | Specifies the fact that a System Capability is refined by System Requirements. | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | System Use Case | The System Use Cases are a table of content of the services provided by the System of Interest to its System Actors. A System Use Case is only the abstract of the depicted System behavior and represents the purpose. While the main System of Interest interaction actors participating in this Use Case are identified, the behavior itself is specified by a Use Case Activity, Note: The intended use (and also misuse in so called "black use cases") of the System of Interest is captured in free text; story telling at a coarse level of detail which is understandable to Customers (non engineering stakeholders in general). | . | System of Interest Stakeholder | An individual, team, or organization (or classes thereof) with interests in, or concerns relative to, a system. It may be involved in any life cycle phase of the System. The Stakeholder represents a class or kind of Stakeholders. Stakeholders have a certain involvement: Stakeholder Involvement captures the influence of a project specific Stakeholder on the System. Stakeholder Involvement is characterized by * Contact Person * Kind of involvement * Life Cycle Phases involved * Relevance decision if and up to which degree Stakeholder is considered * Rationale for decision when Stakeholder is not considered | . | Logical Connection | Specifies the connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. Note: Connections between logical components indicate that item flows are passed from one output of a source component to one or more inputs of target components. | . | SCYsupportingSUC | Specifies the fact that a System UseCase is supported by System Capabilities. | . | Operational Performer | An Operational Performer is an element of the Operational Context that is capable to perform Operational Process Activities contributing to a specific identified Operational Capability. An Operational Performer may be any kind of organization, person, or even a system playing a role in one or more Operational Contexts. Aliases: UAF::OperationalPerformer | . | Operational Story | The Operational Story represents one or more Operational Use Cases in the Usage Scenario identified by the Operational Context. The Operational Story is described as narrative story-telling. | . | SCErepresentedBySSH | Specifies the fact that a System Context Element is represented by a SOI Stakeholder. | . | Logical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | SCEactingForOPR | Specifies the fact that a System Context Element is acting for the benefit of an Operational Performer. | . | SUCtakingPlaceInLSC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case takes place in a Logical System Context. | . | SDKderivingFromODK | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind on system level is derived from an Operational Domain Kind. | . | LIPapplyingToLCE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point applies to a Logical Context Element. | . | OCYsupportingOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is supported by Operational Capabilities. | . | Operational Capability | A Operational Capability is a high-level description or specification of an organizational unit's ability to execute a specified course of action, to implement a business process or to provide a service. Operational Capabilities typically require people, processes, infrastructure, technology and supporting systems to be implemented. A Operational Capability is an enduring element, its implementation may change over time. A necessary or desired change of a Operational Capability triggers the updated of involved systems or the integration new systems. Aliases: UAF::Capability NAF4::Capability | . | OPRactingInOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer acts in an Operational Story. | . | Logical SOI Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context SOI exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | OCNallowingOIE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Item Exchange is allowed on the Operational Connection. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | LCEactingInSUC | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element acts in one or more System Use Cases. | . | SCYsatisfyingSHR | Specifies the fact that a System Capability satisfies one or more Stakeholder Requirements. | . | System Requirement | System Requirements specify System Functions, non-functional properties, or constraints of the System. | . | SHRrefiningOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | Operational Connection | Specifies the connection between Operational Context Roles in an Operational Context allowing Operational Item Exchange. Aliases: UAF::OperationalConnector | . | SUCrefiningSHR | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is refined by System Use Cases. | .

698.title: SAF_cross-domain-LD-FD-mapping-wallpaper
698.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | USAGEallocatedTo | Specifies the fact that a Usage of Function is allocated to a Usage of System Element. | . | SPFNallocatedToLET | Specifies the fact that a System Partial Function is assigned to a Logical SOI Element. Note: This fact may be derived from the Usage of Function of a System Partial Function allocated to a Internal Logical Element Role | . | SFNallocatedToLET | Specifies the fact that a System Function is assigned to a Logical SOI. Note: This fact may be derived from the Usage of a System Function in a System Process allocated to a Logical Context SOI Role. | . | Logical System Context | Specifies the fact that a System Context for a System of Interest is defined on Logical Level. | . | Abstract Physical Element | Abstract element representing physical structure items keeping properties and relations applicable to all physical items. | . | Logical Element Role | Specifies the fact that a logical element comprises logical elements. | . | Context Function | Specifies the fact that a fundamental action or task is expected to be carried out by an External Entity. Note: The intention is to capture the expectations and to explicitly dissect the functionality. This must not be interpreted as an attempt for a behavior specification of an External Entity. Capturing this valuable information is the basis to reach agreement on the functionality at the System boundary by clarifying the expectations about what is performed by Context Elements. | . | LETimplementingGFN | Specifies the fact that a Logical Element is responsible to implement a System Function. Note: Logical Elements don't "implement" anything, they pass the function implementation task to Physical Elements. | . | SPFNallocatedToAPE | Specifies the fact that a System Partial Function is assigned to an Abstract Physical Element. Note: This fact may be derived from the Usage of Function of a System Partial Function allocated to a Physical SOI Element Role | . | APEimplementingGFN | | . | Logical Element | Describes a conceptual Logical Element as specification for an implementation of a system, or system element. | . | CFNallocatedToLCE | Specifies the fact that a Context Function is assigned to a Logical Context Element. Note: This fact may be derived from the Usage of Function of a Context Function allocated to a Logical Context Element. | . | System Partial Function | Specifies the fact that a System Partial Function is a decomposed part of a System Function and defines details of the System Function it belongs to. | . | Logical Context Element Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | Logical SOI Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context SOI exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | Logical Context Element | Represents an abstract element in the given System Context on Logical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | General Function | Specifies a General Function. It is used as base Class for specific System or Context Functions, or Partial Functions. | . | General Functional Usage | Specifies a General Usage of a General Function within one or more other General Functions. | . | SFNallocatedToAPE | Specifies the fact that a relationship is derived from the assignment of Functions to Logical Elements and the assignment of Logical Elements to Physical Elements. | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | . | LETspecifyingAPE | Specifies the fact that one or more Logical Element specifies exactly one Physical Element. Rationale: If more than one Physical Element would offer to realize the functionality specified by a Logical Element the responsibility would be ambiguous. It is okay to assign several Logical Elements to one Physical Element. This means all specified functionality assigned to the Logical Elements is to be implemented by the Physical Element. Note, that typically the usage of logical elements in a context is mapped to the usage of physical elements in a context (allocation of usage). Thus this relationship between the definitions is derived. | .

699.title: SAF_cross-domain-interface-wallpaper
699.content: Overview about the relationships between interface related concepts used in the SAF Functional/Logical Domain and the SAF Physical Domain . | Concept | Documentation | . | Physical User | The Physical User is the representation for a human in the physical domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | LIEboundedByPLS | Specifies the fact that a Logical Item Exchange is constrained to be implemented on a particular Physical Layer Stack. | . | SDKtypingLIE | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Item Exchange. | . | Physical Layer Stack | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | PIPapplyingToAPE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point applies to an Abstract Physical Element. | . | LCNallowingLIE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Item Exchange is allowed on the Logical Connection. | . | Physical Exchange Kind | Specification for any kind of physical item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Physical Level. This is the realization of the specification made by System Domain Kinds. | . | PEKisAssignedToPL | Specifies the fact that a Physical Exchange Kind is assigned to a particular Physical Layer. | . | Logical External System | A Logical External System in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., power grid, mobile network, fresh water system (in a house). | . | PCPOverPCP | Specifies the fact that a physical interaction point communicates / transfers / flows / over an other physical interaction point. Used to define layered physical interfaces, and show layer relationships between interfaces. | . | Physical Connector Compatibility | Specifies the fact that two Physical Interaction Point Definitions are compatible and how the Physical Interaction Point Properties are mapped. | . | Physical Layer | Specifies a Physical Layer, usually used for communication. | . | PIPapplyingToPCE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point applies to a Physical Context Element. | . | Abstract Physical Element | Abstract element representing physical structure items keeping properties and relations applicable to all physical items. | . | LCPboundedByPLS | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point is constrained to be implemented on a particular Physical Layer Stack. | . | LIPDdefiningDetailOfLIP | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point Definition defines the exchange capabilities of a Logical Interaction Point. | . | PEKtypingPIE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Exchange Kind defines the type of a Physical Item Exchange. | . | Physical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a Physical Connection. | . | Physical Interaction Point Definition | Specifies the exchange capabilities of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | Physical Connection | Specifies the connection of two physical interaction points. Note: Connections between physical components indicate that item flows are passed from one output of a source component to one or more inputs of target components. | . | PIPPspecifyingDetailOfPIPD | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point Property is a detail of a Physical Interaction Point Definition. | . | Logical Interaction Point Definition | Specifies the exchange capabilities of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | Logical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. | . | Logical Context Element | Represents an abstract element in the given System Context on Logical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | SDKtypingLIPP | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Interaction Point Property. | . | Physical Layer Ordering | Specifies an order among two physical layers. This order is valid within a Physical Layer Stack | . | Physical Context Element | Abstract element of a System Context on Physical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | PLOisValidInPLS | Specifies the fact that a Physical Layer Ordering is valid within a particular Physical Layer Stack. | . | Physical Environment | The Physical Environment in the Physical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g. air, dirt, sun, road. | . | PEKtypingPIPP | Specifies the fact that a Physical Exchange Kind defines the type of a Physical Interaction Point Property. | . | Physical Element | A composition of Hardware and Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model segments and system. See [VXT]. | . | Logical Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | PIPDdefiningDetailOfPIP | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point Definition defines the exchange capabilities of a Physical Interaction Point. | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | Software Element | Pure Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "software unit". | . | Physical External System | The Physical External System in the Physical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g. power grid, mobile network, fresh water system (in a house). | . | Logical Connection | Specifies the connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. Note: Connections between logical components indicate that item flows are passed from one output of a source component to one or more inputs of target components. | . | Physical SOI | Represents the Physical SOI on Physical Level. | . | Logical Environment | A Logical Environment in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., air, dirt, sun, road. | . | Physical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | LIEboundedByPL | Specifies the fact that a Logical Item Exchange is constrained to be implemented on a particular Physical Layer. | . | Logical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | Logical Element | Describes a conceptual Logical Element as specification for an implementation of a system, or system element. | . | PCNallowingPIE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Item Exchange is allowed on the Physical Connection. | . | Logical User | The Logical User is the representation for a human in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | Physical Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | LIPapplyingToLCE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point applies to a Logical Context Element. | . | LIPapplyingToLET | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point applies to a Logical Element. | . | PEKrealizingSDK | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind is realized by Physical Exchange Kinds. | . | Hardware Element | Pure Hardware Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "hardware unit". | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | PCCassertsCompatibiltyForPCPD | Specifies the Physical Interaction Point Definition the Physical Compatibility Assertion is valid for. | . | PCCapplyingToPCN | Specifies the fact that a Physical Connector Compatibility Assertion shall apply to a Physical Connection. | . | LIPPspecifyingDetailOfLIPD | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point Property is a detail of a Logical Interaction Point Definition. | .

700.title: SAF_domain_kind_F_Definition
700.content: Describes concepts used to describe exchanged items in the SAF Functional and SAF Logical Domain and related concepts . | Concept | Documentation | . | SDKtypingFPM | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Function Parameter. | . | SDKtypingLIE | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Item Exchange. | . | Operational Domain Kind | Specifies the kind of Operational Item Exchange between Operational Context Roles or Operational Processes. | . | Physical Exchange Kind | Specification for any kind of physical item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Physical Level. This is the realization of the specification made by System Domain Kinds. | . | SDKderivingFromODK | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind on system level is derived from an Operational Domain Kind. | . | Logical Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | PEKrealizingSDK | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind is realized by Physical Exchange Kinds. | . | General Function Usage Exchange Point | A parameter of a System or Context Function. | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | System State | Describes a state (or mode) of something that can have distinct states. | . | Logical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. | . | SDKtypingLIPP | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Interaction Point Property. | . | SDKbeeingInSSE | Specifies that a System Domain Kind can have certain states. Note: Of course an item is in only one distinct state at a certain time. The multiplicity means that an Item can have a set of possible states, and a state can be used to specify possible States for several domain items. | .

701.title: SAF_domain_kind_O_Definition
701.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | ODKcomposedOF | Specifies the fact that an Operational Domain Kind consists of one or more Operational Domain Kinds. | . | Operational Domain Kind | Specifies the kind of Operational Item Exchange between Operational Context Roles or Operational Processes. | . | SDKcomposedOF | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind consists of one or more System Domain Kinds. | . | Operational Process | An Operational Process captures activity-based operational behavior including scenarios, activity actions, and operational exchange flows, e.g., including information, materials, natural resources, etc. Aliases: UAF::Operational Activity NAF::Logical Activity | . | SDKderivingFromODK | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind on system level is derived from an Operational Domain Kind. | . | Operational Item Exchange | Specifies the Operational Item Exchange that is to take place on an Operational Connection. Aliases: UAF::OperationalExchange | . | ODKtypifyingOIE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Domain Kind typifies an Operational Item Exchange. | . | ODKtypifyingOPE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Domain Kind typifies an Operational Process Exchange. | . | Operational Process Exchange | Specifies the fact that an Operational Process has an exchange with another Operational Process. | .

702.title: SAF_framework_Definition
702.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | VPbelongingToAT | specifies that a viewpoint belongs to one aspect. | . | GDcontainingAT | Specifies that the grid is composed of several aspects. | . | VPframesCN | Specifies that a Viewpoint frames one or more concerns. That means that the views conform to that viewpoint satisfy the information need expressed by the concerns. | . | SECrelatesToSEC | specifies a relationship of a concept to an other. | . | VPbelongingToDN | specifies that a viewpoint belongs to one domain. | . | Domain | Domain captures viewpoints that belong together within typical SE workflow stages. | . | UML Metaclass | A metaclass from UML | . | GDcontainingVP | Specifies that the grid contains multiple viewpoints | . | SSTimplementsVP | specifies, that one ore more SAF Stereotypes implement a viewpoint. Note: Multiple Stereotypes are used if there are alternate presentations. | . | Stakeholder | specifies someone (typically a role) having an information need within an MBSE approach. | . | GDcontainingDN | Specifies that the grid is composed of several domains. | . | VWconformingToVP | specifies that a view conforms to a viewpoint. | . | Rationale | Specifies why a stakeholder has a concern. Typically that has to do with the work a stakeholder has to do within an MBSE approach. | . | SAF Stereotype | A stereotype of the SAF Profile Model | . | Grid | The grid manages the viewpoints in grid cells assigned to the categories of an domain (row) and an aspect (column). | . | Concern | Specifies an information need that a stakeholder of the SAF needs to be satisfied within an MBSE approach using SAF. | . | SE Concept | specifies a SE concept to be supported by SAF | . | Aspect | Aspects capture a set of characteristics or features of the Entity of Interest in its Environment to address Concerns within an Architecture Description. | . | View | A architecture view comprises portion of an architecture description and addresses information-relevant concerns framed by a architecture viewpoint. | . | SysML Stereotype | A stereotype from sysml | . | PIimplementsSEC | specifies that a stereotype from the SAF profile implements a concept | . | Viewpoint | A architecture viewpoint defines set of conventions for the creation, interpretation and use of an architecture view to frame one or more concerns | . | ProfileItem | | . | SECisProvidedByVP | Specifies, that one or more SE Concepts are provided by the Viewpoints Views | .

703.title: SAF_functional_concept_Definition
703.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | GFEfromGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is coming from a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | General Function Usage Exchange Point | A parameter of a System or Context Function. | . | GFUEPsendingOUTPUT | Specifies the Output of a Functional Usage. | . | GFUEPreceivingINPUT | Specifies the Input of a Functional Usage. | . | General Functional Exchange | Specifies the fact that an General Functional Exchange between General Function Parameters is taking place. | . | GFEtoGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is going to a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | General Function | Specifies a General Function. It is used as base Class for specific System or Context Functions, or Partial Functions. | . | General Functional Usage | Specifies a General Usage of a General Function within one or more other General Functions. | . | GFEbeingPartOfGFNU | Specifies the fact that a Functional Exchange appears within a general Functiona Usage. | . | GFNcontrolledAFTER | Specifies a sequential execution of Functions. | .

704.title: SAF_functional_domain_wallpaper
704.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | Logical External System | A Logical External System in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., power grid, mobile network, fresh water system (in a house). | . | Logical System Context | Specifies the fact that a System Context for a System of Interest is defined on Logical Level. | . | GFUEPreceivingINPUT | Specifies the Input of a Functional Usage. | . | SFNresultingInSSE | Specifies the fact that a System Function can perform a particular set of transitions, resulting in the related target System States. | . | GFEtoGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is going to a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | SUCincludingSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case includes other System Use Cases. The included use case is then no longer a full System Use Case, but a partial System Use Case. | . | SRderivingFromSTKR | Specifies the fact that a System Requirement is derived from a Stakeholder Requirement. Note: It may be used in a customer supplier relationship situation and supports the V Model concept of "External Unit Specification". See [VXT]. | . | GFEfromGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is coming from a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | Context Function | Specifies the fact that a fundamental action or task is expected to be carried out by an External Entity. Note: The intention is to capture the expectations and to explicitly dissect the functionality. This must not be interpreted as an attempt for a behavior specification of an External Entity. Capturing this valuable information is the basis to reach agreement on the functionality at the System boundary by clarifying the expectations about what is performed by Context Elements. | . | System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Process captures system behavior as a specific sequence of actions or tasks, and system exchanges including information, materials, energy, etc. | . | Context Function IN System Process | Specifies the fact that a Context Function is used in a System Process. | . | FRrefiningSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is refined by Functional Requirements. | . | General Function Usage Exchange Point | A parameter of a System or Context Function. | . | GFUEPsendingOUTPUT | Specifies the Output of a Functional Usage. | . | Logical Context Element Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | SUChasPostConditionSSE | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case has a state as Postcondition. | . | SRrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by System Requirements. | . | Logical Context Element | Represents an abstract element in the given System Context on Logical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | General Function | Specifies a General Function. It is used as base Class for specific System or Context Functions, or Partial Functions. | . | General Functional Usage | Specifies a General Usage of a General Function within one or more other General Functions. | . | LCEperformingCFN | Specifies the fact that a Context Function is expected to be carried out by the Logical Context Element in this System Context. | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | . | System Function IN System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Process. | . | Non-functional Requirement | Non-Functional Requirements specify the quality of System Functions, or non-functional requests like legal conformance. | . | FRboundedByNFR | Specifies the fact that a Non-Functional Requirement constrains Functional Requirements. | . | SUChasPreConditionSSE | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case has a state as Precondition. | . | General Functional Exchange | Specifies the fact that an General Functional Exchange between General Function Parameters is taking place. | . | System Use Case | The System Use Cases are a table of content of the services provided by the System of Interest to its System Actors. A System Use Case is only the abstract of the depicted System behavior and represents the purpose. While the main System of Interest interaction actors participating in this Use Case are identified, the behavior itself is specified by a Use Case Activity, Note: The intended use (and also misuse in so called "black use cases") of the System of Interest is captured in free text; story telling at a coarse level of detail which is understandable to Customers (non engineering stakeholders in general). | . | LETperformingSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is expected to be carried out by the SOI in this System Context. | . | SPSrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by one System Process. | . | GFEbeingPartOfGFNU | Specifies the fact that a Functional Exchange appears within a general Functiona Usage. | . | GFNcontrolledAFTER | Specifies a sequential execution of Functions. | . | SRderivingFromSR | Specifies the fact that System Requirements are derived from a Stakeholder Requirement. Note: This is the relationship of requirements of different architectural levels. When the team responsible for the subsystem has direct access to the full upstream requirements set, then no subcontractor relationship needs to be established. | . | Logical Environment | A Logical Environment in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., air, dirt, sun, road. | . | Functional Requirement | Functional Requirements specify System Functions of the System. | . | State Transition | Describes an allowed transition between two states of an item that can be in distinct States. | . | SUCsynthesizingSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Use Case, e.g., as a Trigger, Action, or Task. Note: This is a derived relationship. | . | Logical User | The Logical User is the representation for a human in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | SUCtakingPlaceInLSC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case takes place in a Logical System Context. | . | Logical SOI Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context SOI exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | System State | Describes a state (or mode) of something that can have distinct states. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | LCEactingInSUC | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element acts in one or more System Use Cases. | . | System Requirement | System Requirements specify System Functions, non-functional properties, or constraints of the System. | . | SSEperformingSFN | Specifies the fact that the Function is only provided in distinct States. The state is a precondition for the Function to be able to perform. | .

Specific characteristics and features or, in case of persons or organizational units, knowledge and skills are assigned to a role necessary for the execution of the performed Operational Processes. | . | CallowingE | Specifies the fact that a connection allows Exchange to happen | . | Operational Item Exchange | Specifies the Operational Item Exchange that is to take place on an Operational Connection. Note: Connections between physical components indicate that item flows are passed from one output of a source component to one or more inputs of target components. | . | Logical Context Element Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context Element exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | PIPPspecifyingDetailOfPIPD | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point Property is a detail of a Physical Interaction Point Definition. | . | OIScontainingOCM | Specifies the fact that an Operational Interaction Scenario contains one or more Operational Chronological Messages. | . | Logical Interaction Point Definition | Specifies the exchange capabilities of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | Logical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. | . | Logical Context Element | Represents an abstract element in the given System Context on Logical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | SDKtypingLIPP | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Interaction Point Property. | . | Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point. | . | EKtypingIPP | Specifies the fact that a Exchange Kind defines the type of a Interaction Point Property. | . | Physical Context Element | Abstract element of a System Context on Physical Level, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | Physical Environment | The Physical Environment in the Physical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g. air, dirt, sun, road. | . | Operational Chronological Message | Ordered sequential occurrence of exchanges between Operational Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | Physical Element | A composition of Hardware and Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model segments and system. See [VXT]. | . | PIPDdefiningDetailOfPIP | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point Definition defines the exchange capabilities of a Physical Interaction Point. | . | Physical External System | The Physical External System in the Physical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g. power grid, mobile network, fresh water system (in a house). | . | Connection | Specifies the connection of two interaction points. | . | System Context Role | General role of a Logical System Context. | . | Logical Connection | Specifies the connection of two interaction points on Logical Level. Note: Connections between logical components indicate that item flows are passed from one output of a source component to one or more inputs of target components. | . | Physical SOI | Represents the Physical SOI on Physical Level. | . | Operational Performer | An Operational Performer is an element of the Operational Context that is capable to perform Operational Process Activities contributing to a specific identified Operational Capability. An Operational Performer may be any kind of organization, person, or even a system playing a role in one or more Operational Contexts. Aliases: UAF::OperationalPerformer | . | Logical Environment | A Logical Environment in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., air, dirt, sun, road. | . | General Context Element Role | Specifies the fact that a General Context Element exists in a given General Context. | . | Logical Element | Describes a conceptual Logical Element as specification for an implementation of a system, or system element. | . | Logical User | The Logical User is the representation for a human in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. | . | Physical Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | LIPapplyingToLET | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point applies to a Logical Element. | . | LIPapplyingToLCE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point applies to a Logical Context Element. | . | SCIScontainingLCM | Specifies the fact that a System Context Interaction Scenario contains one or more System Context Chronological Messages. | . | SMhavingGF | Specifies, that a system has general functions. | . | Exchange | Specification for general item exchange (energy, material, information, etc.). | . | PCPisPartOfPIPD | specifies that a physical interaction point can be a part of a physical interaction point definition. This fosters reuse and allows structuring of definitions. | . | OCNallowingOIE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Item Exchange is allowed on the Operational Connection. | . | Hardware Element | Pure Hardware Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "hardware unit". | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | PCCassertsCompatibiltyForPCPD | Specifies the Physical Interaction Point Definition the Physical Compatibility Assertion is valid for. | . | PCCapplyingToPCN | Specifies the fact that a Physical Connector Compatibility Assertion shall apply to a Physical Connection. | . | LIPPspecifyingDetailOfLIPD | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point Property is a detail of a Logical Interaction Point Definition. | . | SMhavingIP | Specifies the fact that a System has one or more Interaction Points. | . | General Context | Specifies a General Context. | . | SDKtypingLIE | Specifies the fact that a System Domain Kind defines the type of a Logical Item Exchange. | . | System Context Interaction Scenario | Ordered sequence of exchanges of information, energy, or material between System Context Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | PIPapplyingToAPE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point applies to an Abstract Physical Element. | . | LCNallowingLIE | Specifies the fact that a Logical Item Exchange is allowed on the Logical Connection. | . | Physical Exchange Kind | Specification for any kind of physical item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Physical Level. This is the realization of the specification made by System Domain Kinds. | . | Operational Scenario Participation | Specifies the fact that an Operational Context Role participates in an Operational Interaction Scenario. | . | Logical External System | A Logical External System in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. E.g., power grid, mobile network, fresh water system (in a house). | . | Logical System Context | Specifies the fact that a System Context for a System of Interest is defined on Logical Level. | . | PCPOverPCP | Specifies the fact that a physical interaction point communicates / transfers / flows / over an other physical interaction point. Used to define layered physical interfaces, and show layer relationships between interfaces. | . | IPDtypingIP | Specifies the fact that an Interaction Point Definition defines the exchange capabilities of an Interaction Point. | . | Physical Connector Compatibility | Specifies the fact that two Physical Interaction Point Definitions are compatible and how the Physical Interaction Point Properties are mapped. | . | PIPapplyingToPCE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Interaction Point applies to a Physical Context Element. | . | Abstract Physical Element | Abstract element representing physical structure items keeping properties and relations applicable to all physical items. | . | System Context Scenario Participation | Specifies the fact that a System Context Role participates in a System Context Interaction Scenario. | . | ODKtypifyingOIE | Specifies the fact that an Operational Domain Kind typifies an Operational Item Exchange. | . | Logical Element Role | Specifies the fact that a logical element comprises logical elements. | . | PEKtypingPIE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Exchange Kind defines the type of a Physical Item Exchange. | . | General Chronological Message | Ordered sequential occurrence of exchanges between General Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | Context Function | Specifies the fact that a fundamental action or task is expected to be carried out by an External Entity. Note: The intention is to capture the expectations and to explicitly dissect the functionality. This must not be interpreted as an attempt for a behavior specification of an External Entity. Capturing this valuable information is the basis to reach agreement on the functionality at the System boundary by clarifying the expectations about what is performed by Context Elements. | . | Interaction Point Definition | Specifies the exchange capabilities of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | Physical Item Exchange | Specifies the exchange that is to take place on a Physical Connection. | . | IPPisDetailOfIPD | Specifies the fact that an Interaction Point Property is a detail of an Interaction Point Definition. | . | Physical Interaction Point Definition | Specifies the exchange capabilities of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | Exchange Kind | Specification for a general kind of item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged. | . | Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point. | . | Operational Context | An Operational Context is representing a separate Usage Scenario with a specific configuration of Operational Performers, these are interacting in the Scenario exhibiting a specific identified Operational Capability. One or more Operational Contexts meaningful for the Operational Domain are to be identified. Aliases: UAF::HighLevelOperationalConcept | . | General Scenario Participation | Specifies the fact that a System Role participates in a General Interaction Scenario. | . | LIScontainingILCM | Specifies the fact that an Internal Logical Interaction Scenario contains one or more Internal Logical Chronological Messages. | . | EKtypingE | Specifies the fact that a Exchange Kind defines the type of a Exchange. | . | General Function | Specifies a General Function. It is used as base Class for specific System or Context Functions, or Partial Functions. | . | General Functional Usage | Specifies a General Usage of a General Function within one or more other General Functions. | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | . | PEKtypingPIPP | Specifies the fact that a Physical Exchange Kind defines the type of a Physical Interaction Point Property. | . | System Context Chronological Message | Ordered sequential occurrence of exchanges between System Context Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | Logical Chronological Message | Ordered sequential occurrence of exchanges between Logical Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | Logical Interaction Point Property | Specifies a detail of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | System Of Interest | An abstract element representing a SOI. Base class for specific kinds of SOIs. | . | Software Element | Pure Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "software unit". | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | Physical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Physical Level. | . | System | An abstract element representing a System. | . | Logical Scenario Participation | Specifies the fact that a Logical Element Role participates in a Logical Interaction Scenario. | . | Logical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | General Interaction Scenario | Ordered sequence of exchanges of information, energy, or material between General Interaction Scenario Participants. | . | PCNallowingPIE | Specifies the fact that a Physical Item Exchange is allowed on the Physical Connection. | . | Logical SOI Role | Specifies the fact that a Logical Context SOI exists in a given Logical System Context. | . | PCPPOverPCPP | Specifies the fact that a physical interaction point property communicates / transfers / flows / over an other physical interaction point property. Used to define layered physical interfaces, and show layer relationships between interface details. | . | Operational Connection | Specifies the connection between Operational Context Roles in an Operational Context allowing Operational Item Exchange. Aliases: UAF::OperationalConnector | .

713.title: SAF_need_concept_Definition
713.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | SSHrepresentingUSR | Specifies the fact that an User is represented by Stakeholders. | . | SHRrefiningCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Concern is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | System of Interest Concern | Any kind of interest a Stakeholder has. Note: Redundant with the meaning of "Need"? | . | SSHhavingCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder has certain Concerns. | . | Need | A User has a Need in order to reach a certain Goal. Note: "Buying sugar to bake a birthday cake". | . | System Of Interest | An abstract element representing a SOI. Base class for specific kinds of SOIs. | . | satisfyingSHR | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is satisfied by SAF Model Elements. | . | SHRimposedBY | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is provided by Stakeholders. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | Any SAF Element | A concept used only together with relational concepts to specify that the relation goes to any other SAF Concept. | . | System of Interest Stakeholder | An individual, team, or organization (or classes thereof) with interests in, or concerns relative to, a system. It may be involved in any life cycle phase of the System. The Stakeholder represents a class or kind of Stakeholders. Stakeholders have a certain involvement: Stakeholder Involvement captures the influence of a project specific Stakeholder on the System. Stakeholder Involvement is characterized by * Contact Person * Kind of involvement * Life Cycle Phases involved * Relevance decision if and up to which degree Stakeholder is considered * Rationale for decision when Stakeholder is not considered | . | Goal | A Goal is defined as an end state that a Stakeholder intends to achieve. Goals are generally expressed using qualitative words; e.g., “increase”, “improve”, or “easier”. Goals can also be decomposed; e.g., “increase profit” can be decomposed into the Goals “reduce cost” and “increase sales”. However, it is also very common to associate concrete objectives with Goals, which can be used to describe both the quantitative and time-related measures which are essential to describe the desired state, and when it should be achieved. | . | SSHrelatedToSSH | Explains relations between the Stakeholders of the System and other relevant System parties. It helps to understand the Stakeholder community and to approach the right point of contact for clarification of project relevant issues. | . | User | Representation for a human in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. Note: This seems to be highly redundant with definition of "Role". | .

714.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | SHRrefiningCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Concern is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | SOIactingForOPR | Specifies the fact that a SOI is acting for the benefit of an Operational Performer. | . | Operational Process | An Operational Process captures activity-based operational behavior including scenarios, activity actions, and operational exchange flows, e.g., including information, materials, natural resources, etc. Aliases: UAF::Operational Activity NAF::Logical Activity | . | Operational Context Role | An Operational Context Role represents a participant in an Operational context. It is interacting with other roles of the given Operational Context. Specific characteristics and features or, in case of persons or organizational units, knowledge and skills are assigned to a role necessary for the execution of the performed Operational Processes. | . | System of Interest Concern | Any kind of interest a Stakeholder has. Note: Redundant with the meaning of "Need"? | . | OPRcapableOFperformingOPS | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer performs an Operational Activity. Traceability from Operational Activities to Operational Performers is derived via assignment of Operational Action to Operational Roles. Aliases: UAF::IsCapableToPerform | . | OPRcomposedOF | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer consists of one or more Operational Performers. | . | OPSenablingOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Process contributes to the provision of one or more Operational Capabilities in the field. Aliases: UAF::MapsToCapability | . | Operational Process Usage | Specifies the fact that an Operational Process is used in context of another Operational Process. Aliases: UAF::OperationalAction | . | Operational Context | An Operational Context is representing a separate Usage Scenario with a specific configuration of Operational Performers, these are interacting in the Scenario exhibiting a specific identified Operational Capability. One or more Operational Contexts meaningful for the Operational Domain are to be identified. Aliases: UAF::HighLevelOperationalConcept | . | OPRexhibitingOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer exhibits an Operational Capability under specific environmental conditions. | . | SHRimposedBY | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is provided by Stakeholders. | . | controlledAFTER | Specifies the sequencing of Operational Processes in time. | . | SSHrelatedToSSH | Explains relations between the Stakeholders of the System and other relevant System parties. It helps to understand the Stakeholder community and to approach the right point of contact for clarification of project relevant issues. | . | SSHrepresentingOPR | Specifies the fact that a SOI Stakeholder is representing an Operational Performer. | . | SSHhavingCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder has certain Concerns. | . | System Of Interest | An abstract element representing a SOI. Base class for specific kinds of SOIs. | . | OPRperformingOPSU | Specifies that an Operational Context Role uses an Operational Process in the context of an other Operational Process. | . | System of Interest Stakeholder | An individual, team, or organization (or classes thereof) with interests in, or concerns relative to, a system. It may be involved in any life cycle phase of the System. The Stakeholder represents a class or kind of Stakeholders. Stakeholders have a certain involvement: Stakeholder Involvement captures the influence of a project specific Stakeholder on the System. Stakeholder Involvement is characterized by * Contact Person * Kind of involvement * Life Cycle Phases involved * Relevance decision if and up to which degree Stakeholder is considered * Rationale for decision when Stakeholder is not considered | . | Operational Performer | An Operational Performer is an element of the Operational Context that is capable to perform Operational Process Activities contributing to a specific identified Operational Capability. An Operational Performer may be any kind of organization, person, or even a system playing a role in one or more Operational Contexts. Aliases: UAF::OperationalPerformer | . | Operational Story | The Operational Story represents one or more Operational Use Cases in the Usage Scenario identified by the Operational Context. The Operational Story is described as narrative story-telling. | . | OCYspecializedBY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability is specialized by other Operational Capability. Aliases: UAF::CapabilityGeneralization | . | OCYcomposedOF | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability consists of other Operational Capabilites. | . | OCYdependingON | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability depends on another Operational Capability. Aliases: UAF::CapabilityDependency | . | OCYsupportingOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is supported by Operational Capabilities. | . | Operational Capability | A Operational Capability is a high-level description or specification of an organizational unit's ability to execute a specified course of action, to implement a business process or to provide a service. Operational Capabilities typically require people, processes, infrastructure, technology and supporting systems to be implemented. A Operational Capability is an enduring element, its implementation may change over time. A necessary or desired change of a Operational Capability triggers the updated of involved systems or the integration new systems. Aliases: UAF::Capability NAF4::Capability | . | OPRactingInOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Performer acts in an Operational Story. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | Operational Process Exchange | Specifies the fact that an Operational Process has an exchange with another Operational Process. | .

716.title: SAF_requirement_F_Definition
716.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | SRrefiningLICP | Specifies the fact that a Logical Interaction Point is refined by System Requirements. | . | Operational Process | An Operational Process captures activity-based operational behavior including scenarios, activity actions, and operational exchange flows, e.g., including information, materials, natural resources, etc. Aliases: UAF::Operational Activity NAF::Logical Activity | . | System Function IN System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Process. | . | SUCenablingOSY | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case enables the realization of an Operational Story. | . | Non-functional Requirement | Non-Functional Requirements specify the quality of System Functions, or non-functional requests like legal conformance. | . | FRboundedByNFR | Specifies the fact that a Non-Functional Requirement constrains Functional Requirements. | . | System Use Case | The System Use Cases are a table of content of the services provided by the System of Interest to its System Actors. A System Use Case is only the abstract of the depicted System behavior and represents the purpose. While the main System of Interest interaction actors participating in this Use Case are identified, the behavior itself is specified by a Use Case Activity, Note: The intended use (and also misuse in so called "black use cases") of the System of Interest is captured in free text; story telling at a coarse level of detail which is understandable to Customers (non engineering stakeholders in general). | . | SUCincludingSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case includes other System Use Cases. The included use case is then no longer a full System Use Case, but a partial System Use Case. | . | OPSrefiningOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is refined by one or more Operational Processes. | . | SPSrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by one System Process. | . | SRderivingFromSTKR | Specifies the fact that a System Requirement is derived from a Stakeholder Requirement. Note: It may be used in a customer supplier relationship situation and supports the V Model concept of "External Unit Specification". See [VXT]. | . | SFNboundedByNFR | Specifies the fact that a Non-functional Requirement constrains System Functions. | . | Operational Story | The Operational Story represents one or more Operational Use Cases in the Usage Scenario identified by the Operational Context. The Operational Story is described as narrative story-telling. | . | SRderivingFromSR | Specifies the fact that System Requirements are derived from a Stakeholder Requirement. Note: This is the relationship of requirements of different architectural levels. When the team responsible for the subsystem has direct access to the full upstream requirements set, then no subcontractor relationship needs to be established. | . | Functional Requirement | Functional Requirements specify System Functions of the System. | . | SPSenablingOPS | Specifies the fact that a System Process enables the accomplishment of an Operational Process. | . | System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Process captures system behavior as a specific sequence of actions or tasks, and system exchanges including information, materials, energy, etc. | . | Logical Interaction Point | Specifies the existence of an interaction point on Logical Level. | . | SUCsynthesizingSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Use Case, e.g., as a Trigger, Action, or Task. Note: This is a derived relationship. | . | FRrefiningSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is refined by Functional Requirements. | . | SRrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by System Requirements. | . | controlledAFTER | Specifies the sequencing of Operational Processes in time. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | System Requirement | System Requirements specify System Functions, non-functional properties, or constraints of the System. | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | . | SUCrefiningSHR | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is refined by System Use Cases. | .

717.title: SAF_requirement_O_Definition
717.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | SSHrepresentingUSR | Specifies the fact that an User is represented by Stakeholders. | . | SHRrefiningCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Concern is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | System of Interest Concern | Any kind of interest a Stakeholder has. Note: Redundant with the meaning of "Need"? | . | Compliance Statement | Used in the communication between Stakeholder (Customer) and Contractor. Compliance Statements are the first answer to the Stakeholder Requirements and are usually together with the Stakeholder Requirements part of the contract. They are valuable input for the System development and System Requirement elicitation. Information status: * not compliant (with explanation / rationale) * partially compliant (with explanation / rationale) * fully compliant | . | SSHhavingCRN | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder has certain Concerns. | . | Need | A User has a Need in order to reach a certain Goal. Note: "Buying sugar to bake a birthday cake". | . | OCYsupportingOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is supported by Operational Capabilities. | . | Operational Capability | A Operational Capability is a high-level description or specification of an organizational unit's ability to execute a specified course of action, to implement a business process or to provide a service. Operational Capabilities typically require people, processes, infrastructure, technology and supporting systems to be implemented. A Operational Capability is an enduring element, its implementation may change over time. A necessary or desired change of a Operational Capability triggers the updated of involved systems or the integration new systems. Aliases: UAF::Capability NAF4::Capability | . | SHRrefiningOCY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Capability is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | satisfyingSHR | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is satisfied by SAF Model Elements. | . | CSTconfirmingSHR | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement has certain States of Compliance. | . | SHRimposedBY | Specifies the fact that a Stakeholder Requirement is provided by Stakeholders. | . | Stakeholder Requirement | A Stakeholder Requirement is a Requirement imposed by a Stakeholder. Stakeholder Concerns are refined by Stakeholder Requirements applicable for the SOI. The Stakeholder Requirements are a result of discussions and agreements of how the SOI addresses the Concerns of the respective Stakeholder. | . | Any SAF Element | A concept used only together with relational concepts to specify that the relation goes to any other SAF Concept. | . | System of Interest Stakeholder | An individual, team, or organization (or classes thereof) with interests in, or concerns relative to, a system. It may be involved in any life cycle phase of the System. The Stakeholder represents a class or kind of Stakeholders. Stakeholders have a certain involvement: Stakeholder Involvement captures the influence of a project specific Stakeholder on the System. Stakeholder Involvement is characterized by * Contact Person * Kind of involvement * Life Cycle Phases involved * Relevance decision if and up to which degree Stakeholder is considered * Rationale for decision when Stakeholder is not considered | . | SHRrefiningOSY | Specifies the fact that an Operational Story is refined by Stakeholder Requirements. | . | Goal | A Goal is defined as an end state that a Stakeholder intends to achieve. Goals are generally expressed using qualitative words; e.g., “increase”, “improve”, or “easier”. Goals can also be decomposed; e.g., “increase profit” can be decomposed into the Goals “reduce cost” and “increase sales”. However, it is also very common to associate concrete objectives with Goals, which can be used to describe both the quantitative and time-related measures which are essential to describe the desired state, and when it should be achieved. | . | SSHrelatedToSSH | Explains relations between the Stakeholders of the System and other relevant System parties. It helps to understand the Stakeholder community and to approach the right point of contact for clarification of project relevant issues. | . | User | Representation for a human in the Logical Domain, outside the SOI scope, interacting with the SOI. Note: This seems to be highly redundant with definition of "Role". | . | Operational Story | The Operational Story represents one or more Operational Use Cases in the Usage Scenario identified by the Operational Context. The Operational Story is described as narrative story-telling. | .

720.title: SAF_state_F_Definition
720.content: . | Concept | Documentation | . | Physical Element | A composition of Hardware and Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model segments and system. See [VXT]. | . | Logical Element | Describes a conceptual Logical Element as specification for an implementation of a system, or system element. | . | State Transition | Describes an allowed transition between two states of an item that can be in distinct States. | . | LETbeeingInSSE | Specifies the System States a Logical Element can be in. | . | APEbeeingInSSE | Specifies the fact that a Physical System Element can be in distinct states. | . | Software Element | Pure Software Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "software unit". | . | System Domain Kind | Specification for any kind of conceptual item (energy, material, information, etc.) to be exchanged on Functional or Logical Level. The System Domain Kind is agnostic to any realization on Physical Level. | . | System State | Describes a state (or mode) of something that can have distinct states. | . | Hardware Element | Pure Hardware Elements. Similarity with the V-Model "hardware unit". | . | Logical Context SOI | Represents the Logical SOI in the System Context on Logical Level. | . | SFNresultingInSSE | Specifies the fact that a System Function can perform a particular set of transitions, resulting in the related target System States. | . | Abstract Physical Element | Abstract element representing physical structure items keeping properties and relations applicable to all physical items. | . | Physical SOI | Represents the Physical SOI on Physical Level. | . | SDKbeeingInSSE | Specifies that a System Domain Kind can have certain states. Note: Of course an item is in only one distinct state at a certain time. The multiplicity means that an Item can have a set of possible states, and a state can be used to specify possible States for several domain items. | . | SSEperformingSFN | Specifies the fact that the Function is only provided in distinct States. The state is a precondition for the Function to be able to perform. | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | .

721.title: SAF_structural_F_Definition
721.content: distinguish between allocation of usage and allocation of definition allocate function to Logical Element . | Concept | Documentation | . | General Function Exchange Point | A Exchange Point of a Function Usage | . | System Partial Function in System Function | Specifies that a System Partial Function is used in a system function | . | GFNreceivingINPUT | Specifies the Input of a General Function. | . | System Function IN System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Process. | . | GFUEPreceivingINPUT | Specifies the Input of a Functional Usage. | . | General Functional Exchange | Specifies the fact that an General Functional Exchange between General Function Parameters is taking place. | . | System Use Case | The System Use Cases are a table of content of the services provided by the System of Interest to its System Actors. A System Use Case is only the abstract of the depicted System behavior and represents the purpose. While the main System of Interest interaction actors participating in this Use Case are identified, the behavior itself is specified by a Use Case Activity, Note: The intended use (and also misuse in so called "black use cases") of the System of Interest is captured in free text; story telling at a coarse level of detail which is understandable to Customers (non engineering stakeholders in general). | . | GFEtoGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is going to a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | GFNsendingOUTPUT | Specifies the Output of a General Function. | . | SUCincludingSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case includes other System Use Cases. The included use case is then no longer a full System Use Case, but a partial System Use Case. | . | SPSrefiningSUC | Specifies the fact that a System Use Case is refined by one System Process. | . | GFEbeingPartOfGFNU | Specifies the fact that a Functional Exchange appears within a general Functiona Usage. | . | GFNcontrolledAFTER | Specifies a sequential execution of Functions. | . | System Capability | 1) A System Capability is an operation or task that performs an action to produce a specific performance-based outcome. NOTE that a system capability represents the potential to perform an action. In contrast, an operational capability may integrate several physical system capabilities to produce a specific outcome to achieve a mission objective. [Wasson2006, SystemAnalysis+Design+Development] 2) System Capabilities, as system assets, characterize the mechanical, electrical, optical, or processing features that enable a system to function, process mission resources, make decisions, and achieve a required level of success based on performance. A system capability is broader in scope than simply a functional element (and performance bounding elements), especially in large, complex ecosystems. It represents a physical potential - strength, ability, endurance - to perform an outcome-based action for a given duration under a specified set of operating environment conditions. [Wasson2006, SystemAnalysis+Design+Development] Aliases: UAF::Capability NAF4::Capability | . | GFEfromGFUEP | Specifies the fact that a General Functional Exchange is coming from a General Functional Usage Exchange Point. | . | Context Function | Specifies the fact that a fundamental action or task is expected to be carried out by an External Entity. Note: The intention is to capture the expectations and to explicitly dissect the functionality. This must not be interpreted as an attempt for a behavior specification of an External Entity. Capturing this valuable information is the basis to reach agreement on the functionality at the System boundary by clarifying the expectations about what is performed by Context Elements. | . | SUCsynthesizingCFN | Specifies the fact that a Context Function is used in a System Use Case, e.g., as a Trigger, Action, or Task. Note: This is a derived relationship. | . | System Process | Specifies the fact that a System Process captures system behavior as a specific sequence of actions or tasks, and system exchanges including information, materials, energy, etc. | . | SPSenablingSCY | Specifies the fact that a System Process contributes to the provision of one or more System Capabilities in the field. | . | SUCsynthesizingSFN | Specifies the fact that a System Function is used in a System Use Case, e.g., as a Trigger, Action, or Task. Note: This is a derived relationship. | . | Context Function IN System Process | Specifies the fact that a Context Function is used in a System Process. | . | System Partial Function | Specifies the fact that a System Partial Function is a decomposed part of a System Function and defines details of the System Function it belongs to. | . | General Function Usage Exchange Point | A parameter of a System or Context Function. | . | GFUEPsendingOUTPUT | Specifies the Output of a Functional Usage. | . | General Function | Specifies a General Function. It is used as base Class for specific System or Context Functions, or Partial Functions. | . | General Functional Usage | Specifies a General Usage of a General Function within one or more other General Functions. | . | GFEPrelatedToGFUEP | specifies that a General Functional Exchange Point is related to a General Function Usage Exchange Point | . | System Function | Specifies the fundamental action or task that have to take place in the System in accepting and processing the inputs and in processing and generating the outputs. A System Function * accepts input from the System boundary * exposes its output at the System boundary * changes the System's State * is dependent on System's State Note: A System Function does not need to expose observable output, when it changes the System's state in a way that is observable by other system functions. Furthermore, a System Function does not need to accept any input from the system boundary, when it is dependent on the System State, which in turn is changeable by other System Functions. | .
